com.augursystems.armi

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.augursystems.armi.Packet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable
    This is the basic wrapper for all messages sent via ARMI. The serialized format of this object is:
    1. dataType (UTF-String)
    2. dataLength (4-byte integer)
    3. data (variable byte array)
    The dataType is is usually a fully-qualified class name, but may be an arbitrary name for passing pure (non-object) data bytes.

    An optional sub-categorization of the class called "flavor" is supported. Sources and listeners may specify a flavor to differentiate between different uses of the same dataType; optionally null if just plain vanilla.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.Serializable decodeInstance()
      If this packet's data contains a Java object of the class named in the dataType field, then this method will unmarshall that object; this object is cached so future calls are not expensive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Packet

        public Packet()
        This constructor is only used by the unwrapSerializable() utility method.

      • Packet

        public Packet(java.io.Serializable a)
        Wraps a generic Serializable in a Packet; useful to wrap a remote return value of unknown Serializable subtype.
        Parameters:
        a - The Serializable to be wrapped in the packet; if null, will be replaced by ArmiString.NULL; the dataFlavor is set to null.

      • Packet

        public Packet(java.io.Serializable a,
              java.lang.String dataFlavor)
        Wraps a generic Serializable in a Packet; useful to wrap a remote return value of unknown Serializable subtype.
        Parameters:
        a - The Serializable to be wrapped in the packet; if null, will be replaced by ArmiString.NULL.
        dataFlavor - The String flavor of the Serializable; optionally null if just plain vanilla.

      • Packet

        public Packet(java.lang.String dataType,
              java.lang.String dataFlavor,
              byte compression,
              byte[] data)
        Creates a Packet. If both dataType and dataFlavor are null, you have a very plain packet indeed.
        Parameters:
        dataType - A String identifier for the data byte[]; usually the fully-qualified String name of the class stored in the data; may be null, although only for unusual circumstances.
        dataFlavor - An optional String that differentiates the purpose of this packet for subscriptions; optionally null if just plain vanilla.
        data - The byte[] containing the your data; usually a serialized version of an Serializable class, named in the dataType parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • readExternal

        public final void readExternal(java.io.ObjectInput in)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Implements Externalizable. Note that this is a two-step process; only the type/flavor and compression fields are initially read; to retrieve the wrapped data object, you call decodeInstance().
        Specified by:
        readExternal in interface java.io.Externalizable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • writeExternal

        public final void writeExternal(java.io.ObjectOutput out)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Implements Externalizable. This Packet wraps a Serializable. It is written in two steps: 1) The data type/flavor and compression algorithm are serialized; 2) the wrapped Serializable is separately serialized and written as a byte[]. This system allows packets to be ignored and/or forwarded without the cost of de-serializing the content.
        Specified by:
        writeExternal in interface java.io.Externalizable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDataFlavor

        public final java.lang.String getDataFlavor()
        Returns:
        The String 'flavor' of this packet; possibly null. See also the documentation of the dataType field.

      • getDataType

        public final java.lang.String getDataType()
        Returns:
        The String 'type' of this packet; usually the fully qualified class name of the Serializable object in this Packet's data payload. See also the documentation of the dataType field.

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the Packet's data payload (usually a Serializable that should be decoded via decodeInstance(), but not necessarily... it could actually be some other binary data passed via the ARMI system.

      • decodeInstance

        public java.io.Serializable decodeInstance()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        If this packet's data contains a Java object of the class named in the dataType field, then this method will unmarshall that object; this object is cached so future calls are not expensive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String formatted with this fully-qualified class name, followed by brackets containing the data type and favor contained in this packet, e.g. "com.augursystems.armi.Packet [com.augursystems.armi.ArmiString/MyFlavor]". If the type or flavor is null, they will be simply blank.
